weekly_top_story.headline: Iran Warns of Retaliation as Protests Kill Hundreds
weekly_top_story.summary: Deadly protests in Iran have resulted in over 500 deaths and 10,000 arrests amid economic unrest and calls to end clerical rule, escalating tensions with U.S. threats of military or cyber action that could destabilize the Middle East.

stories.headline: UN Court Opens Landmark Rohingya Genocide Case
stories.summary: The International Court of Justice has initiated proceedings against Myanmar for genocide against the Rohingya, potentially setting a precedent for international accountability in ethnic cleansing cases.

stories.headline: EU Countries Approve Mercosur Trade Deal After 25 Years
stories.summary: The EU has finally approved a long-stalled trade deal with Mercosur, opening markets for agriculture and industry that could reshape global trade flows and boost economic ties between Europe and South America.
